citeinfo.origin: United States. Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (U.S.)
citeinfo.title: Social Vulnerability Index (SVI) Overall Score by Census Tract, Massachusetts, 2020

descript.abstract:
This layer consists of polygons representing Social Vulnerability Index (SVI) overall scores by 2020 Census Tracts for the state of Massachusetts. This dataset was derived and processed from the CDC ATSDR source dataset: SVI Interactive Map (https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/place-health/php/svi/svi-interactive-map.html). This dataset contains only a small selection of the original attributes available in the source dataset and is joined with US Census Track feature data downloaded from MassGIS. Please refer to the source data set to access the full set of data features.
ATSDR's Geospatial Research, Analysis, & Services Program (GRASP) created the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry Social Vulnerability Index (CDC/ATSDR SVI or simply SVI, hereafter) to help public health officials and emergency response planners identify and map the communities that will most likely need support before, during, and after a hazardous event.
SVI indicates the relative vulnerability of every U.S. Census tract. Census tracts are subdivisions of counties for which the Census collects statistical data. SVI ranks the tracts on 16 social factors, including unemployment, racial and ethnic minority status, and disability, and further groups them into four related themes. Thus, each tract receives a ranking for each Census variable and for each of the four themes as well as an overall ranking.
For more information on SVI definitions and methodology please see: https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/place-health/php/svi/svi-data-documentation-download.html
descript.purpose: This dataset was derived and processed for use as part of a Harvard Library GIS training tutorial.

idinfo.datacred: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry

citeinfo.origin: United States. Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (U.S.)
citeinfo.title: SVI interactive map

procstep.procdesc:
Downloaded Social Vulnerability Index (SVI) data for Massachusetts Census tracts for 2020 from CDC ATSDR as csv data. Retained needed SVI fields, including the tract identifier and overall percentile (RPL_THEMES). Downloaded 2020 Census Tracts for Massachusetts from MassGIS. Created a table join from tracts to the SVI CSV on the 11-digit tract code (tract GEOID in the MassGIS layer to the SVI tract code). Exported the joined features to a new shapefile. Kept a minimal attribute set required for the tutorial and map symbology. Performed basic QA: spot-checked join counts, verified a few tract IDs and percentile values, and validated geometry.
File renamed for HGL delivery as: RTLMOD1_SVI_MA_TRACTS2020

enttyp.enttypd: Social Vulnerability Index (SVI) Overall Score by Census Tract, Massachusetts, 2020

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Join key used to link the attribute table to other tabular data sources in the GIS environment.

attrdomv.udom: String keys matching the feature layer and the CSV table.

attr.attrdef: State FIPS code – two-digit Federal Information Processing Standard code identifying the U.S. state or jurisdiction.
County FIPS code – three-digit code identifying the county (or county equivalent) within the state.

attrdomv.udom: Three-digit numeric string (e.g. "031" for Los Angeles County).

attr.attrdef: Census Tract Code – numeric code assigned to the tract within the county for the 2020 Census geography.
Geographic Identifier – concatenated code combining state FIPS, county FIPS and tract code to uniquely identify the census tract.
Name of the census tract (usually the tract number or label used by the Census Bureau).
Name-Legal/Statistical Area Description – a descriptive label combining the name and the legal/statistical designation of the geographic area (for example "Census Tract 2020").
MAF/TIGER Feature Class Code – a five-character code assigned by the U.S. Census Bureau to classify the type of geographic feature.
Functional Status – a one-character code indicating whether the geographic feature is currently active or inactive (e.g. "S" for active). Derived from Census TIGER/Line attribute schema.
Land area of the tract in square meters, as provided by the U.S. Census Bureau TIGER/Line file.
Water area of the tract in square meters, as provided by the U.S. Census Bureau TIGER/Line file.
Latitude of the interior point of the tract, in decimal degrees (North positive). Provided by TIGER/Line referencing.
Longitude of the interior point of the tract, in decimal degrees (West negative). Provided by TIGER/Line referencing.
Perimeter of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real number (units correspond to coordinate system units).

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Overall percentile ranking for the Social Vulnerability Index (SVI) at the census tract level. Higher values (closer to 1.0) indicate greater relative social vulnerability. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
attr.attrdefs: Percentile rank (0-1) derived from SVI methodology of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention/Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry.

attrdomv.udom: Decimal number between 0.00 and 1.00, where 1.0 indicates the highest vulnerability.
